alert.note: Alert for Breckinridge; Grayson; Hancock; Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:18PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hancock, northwestern Grayson, southwestern Breckinridge and Ohio Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 518 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hartford, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Grayson, southeastern Hancock, Ohio and southwestern Breckinridge Counties, including the following locations... Ralph, Shreve, Tar Fork, Pleasant Ridge, Heflin, Vanzant, Ellmitch, Rockvale, Yeaman and Equality. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central Kentucky.
